titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. E. H. Williams and J. E. Russell, Indictment
CWG6754

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs
E. H. Williams & J. E Russell
City Court of Louisville
Indictment
July Term 1865

The Jurors of the Grand Jury empanelled and sworn to equire in and for the City of Louisville in the name and by Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on their oaths accuse E. H. Williams and J. E. Russell of the offense of managing a lottery for money and that they did in said City and State on the day of July 1865, dispose of personal property of value for money and gain by way of lottery and that the said Willimas and Russell, at the said time and place, and in the disposal of said property by way of Lottery, were partners, all of which is against the Statute in such case made, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
I. Phil Tomppert Jr Clerk of the City Court of Louisville certify that the foregoing is a true Copy of the original on file in my Office
Phil Tomppert Jr C C C L

Commonwealth
vs } Indictment (Copy)
E. H. Williams & J. E. Russell
a true Bill
E H Gardner
Foreman
